intro: Psychotria bracteosa, commonly known as the "Cape Cod" or "Mexican coffee" plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, northern South America, and the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Psychotria bracteosa is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
